title: p-adic valuation
summary: In number theory, the p-adic valuation or p-adic order of an integer n is the exponent of the highest power of the prime number p that divides n. It is denoted ν p ( n ) {\displaystyle \nu _{p}(n)} . Equivalently, ν p ( n ) {\displaystyle \nu _{p}(n)} is the exponent to which p {\displaystyle p} appears in the prime factorization of n {\displaystyle n} .
